message_2:
To find the value of sin(45 degrees) and cos(30 degrees), we can use the special angles in trigonometry.

For a 45-degree angle, sin(45) = cos(45) = √2/2 or 1/√2. So, sin(45 degrees) = √2/2 or 1/√2.

For a 30-degree angle, sin(30) = 1/2 and cos(30) = √3/2. So, cos(30 degrees) = √3/2.

Therefore, sin(45 degrees) = √2/2 or 1/√2, and cos(30 degrees) = √3/2.
